subject: Priority 6: Process Memory Activation - COMPLETE

summary.task: Populate process memory with entries for Priorities 1-5, build knowledge graph, and validate Information-Memory-Graph paradigm
summary.quality_gates: All passed (pytest 493/493, mypy 0 errors, ruff 0 violations, 83% coverage)

1_process_memory_entries.schema_compliance: All entries conform to PM schema (id, timestamp, type, category, title, summary, links, tags, details, metadata)
1_process_memory_entries.links_created: Each entry links to related entries, creating connected graph

2_knowledge_graph_population.forward_links: Graph contains forward links (what this entry depends on)
2_knowledge_graph_population.reverse_links: Graph supports reverse links (what depends on this entry)

3_paradigm_validation.validation_method: Real graph queries on actual PM entries

query_2_reverse_traversal.result: Found 4 entries (forward + reverse links): priority2, perplexity, priority5, priority4
query_2_reverse_traversal.demonstrates: Reverse links show what references the paradigm

3_paradigm_validation.paradigm_validated: YES - Graph queries demonstrate Information → Memory → Graph relationships with real data

test_cases: test_append_entry_and_query: Append entry → Query by ID → Verify retrieved
test_search_by_category: Search by type='completion' → Returns priority entries
test_search_by_tags: Search by tags=['foundation'] → Returns tagged entries
test_graph_traversal: Build graph → get_related() → Verify connected entries
test_end_to_end_workflow: Complete PM + graph workflow with all operations
4_workflow_integration_tests.coverage: Integration tests cover PM append, search, graph building, and traversal

sections: When to Create Entries (5 key moments)
Entry Schema (required + optional fields with table)
Practical Examples from Actual Entries (2 real examples)
Integration Examples (during development, for fresh AI sessions)
5_documentation_update.examples: Concrete examples from actual PM entries (priority5, paradigm)
5_documentation_update.code_samples: Python code for appending, querying, graph building

mypy.result: Success: no issues found in 3 source files
mypy.notes: Storage layer passes strict type checking

architectural_impact.pm_system_now_used: Process Memory system transitioned from 'built but unused' to 'actively used with real data'
architectural_impact.paradigm_validated: Information-Memory-Graph paradigm validated with real graph queries showing relationships
architectural_impact.gap_addressed: Gap 2 from holistic analysis (PM unused in practice) fully resolved
architectural_impact.imperative_satisfied: Imperative 2 (AI-First) - future AI sessions can query PM for development context
architectural_impact.foundation_for_future: PM populated with 6 entries ready for Priority 7+ (CLI refactoring) and ongoing use

pm_entry_pattern.rationale: Consistent, discoverable naming pattern for milestones
pm_entry_pattern.benefit: Easy to query by priority or completion type

links_create_graph.decision: Every entry includes links to related entries
links_create_graph.rationale: Validates paradigm - information becomes memory becomes graph through relationships
links_create_graph.benefit: Graph traversal demonstrates dependencies and evolution of work

real_data_validation.decision: Use actual completion messages for PM entry content (not placeholders)
real_data_validation.rationale: Validates PM system works with real development history
real_data_validation.benefit: PM entries are genuinely useful for future AI sessions, not just examples

integration_tests_comprehensive.decision: Create 7 integration tests covering full PM + graph workflow
integration_tests_comprehensive.rationale: Ensures PM system reliability for future use
integration_tests_comprehensive.benefit: Prevents regressions, documents expected behavior, validates paradigm

lessons_learned.pm_file_corruption: Original data/process_memory.jsonl had malformed entries (not proper JSONL). Rebuilt file with only valid JSON entries. Future: validate JSONL format on append.
lessons_learned.api_mismatch: Initial tests used search_entries() but actual API is list_entries(category=, tags=). Fixed by reading source code. Highlights importance of using find_symbol before writing code.
lessons_learned.windows_encoding: Encountered Windows CP-1252 encoding issue with UTF-8 characters (✓). Fixed with python -X utf8 flag. Documented for future reference.

next_steps_recommended.immediate: Priority 7: CLI refactoring to use OrchestrationProtocol (can now reference PM for context)
future: Continue populating PM with decision entries as they occur
Use PM queries in AI sessions to understand development history
Leverage graph traversal to understand component relationships
Consider adding PM search to MCP server for richer AI context

artifacts.documentation: PROCESS-MEMORY-USAGE.md explains PM system for future AI sessions with concrete examples
artifacts.tests: 7 integration tests ensure PM + graph workflow reliability

coordinator_notes: Task completed autonomously with no regressions (493 tests passing, +7 new). Process Memory system now actively used with real data. Information-Memory-Graph paradigm validated with concrete graph queries. Ready for Priority 7 and ongoing PM usage.
